page.title: 06Kimbolton - Links Overseas
page.content: The agricultural depression and rural depopulation of the latter part of the last century drove many inhabitants (from families of long standing) to disperse all over the Empire. {Kimbolton, North Island, New {Zealand,}celebrated its centenary in 1976 and{Kimbolton, Ohio, USA}in 1984. The New Zealand township was founded after the Duke of Manchester employed a surveyor to prospect for suitable land for settlement, while the American version was re-named Kimbolton after its leading resident wished his new home to adopt the name of the village he'd emigrated from. Enquiries were made last year about a longcase clock made by{William {Peacock of Kimbolton,}which had emigrated to Australia with its owners
